meanings.definition: An attempt to deceive someone into believing that one can or will do something.
meanings.sent1: His bluff about having a pet dragon fooled no one.
meanings.sent2: The con artist's bluff was finally exposed by the police.
meanings.sent3: The magician's bluff of pulling a rabbit out of a hat left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her bluff of being a famous actress crumbled when no one recognized her.
meanings.sent5: The politician's bluff of lowering taxes was met with skepticism by the voters.

meanings.definition: A steep cliff, bank, or promontory.
meanings.sent1: The ship narrowly avoided crashing into the bluff.
meanings.sent2: The hikers admired the view from the top of the bluff.
meanings.sent3: The birds nested on the edge of the bluff, enjoying the scenic overlook.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun cast a warm glow on the bluff, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed against the base of the bluff, eroding it over time.
